title: PhysioTrack one-page landing + daily check-in scoring UI (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Build a single-route PhysioTrack landing page that explains daily check-in, health score, and tips.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the app root shows a single-page layout (no additional pages required to understand/use the site).
The page includes clear sections describing: daily check-in, health score output, and tips guidance.
All user-facing text is in English and references the product name “PhysioTrack”.

file_operations.description: Create the single-route app shell that renders the one-page PhysioTrack landing content at the root (no router required) and composes the hero + sections + Daily Check-in section.

Implement the one-page landing layout with clear English sections: (1) hero/what PhysioTrack does, (2) how the daily check-in works, (3) health score explanation, (4) tips guidance; include calls-to-action that scroll to the Daily Check-in section.
Ensure the root render continues to mount the single-page App correctly once App.tsx exists and that global styles import resolves (keep one-page navigation only).

requirements.summary: Add an interactive Daily Check-in questionnaire with submit, 0–100 score calculation, variable tips, and a retake/edit flow.
acceptanceCriteria: The user can fill out the daily check-in inputs and submit without leaving the page.
After submit, the UI displays a numeric health score between 0 and 100.
After submit, the UI displays a list of tips that changes based on the user’s answers (not a fixed, always-identical list).
The UI includes a clear way to retake/edit the check-in and recalculate the score.

file_operations.description: Create the interactive Daily Check-in UI (sleep, stress, pain/soreness, activity, hydration, mood) with local state, a submit action, results display (score + 3–5 tips), and a clear retake/edit control. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button, Input/Slider, Label) to provide consistent form and card styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement pure frontend scoring utilities that convert questionnaire answers into a 0–100 score and generate 3–5 tips that vary based on answer thresholds (no persistence, no backend calls).
Wire the DailyCheckIn component into the landing page (same route) and ensure the score/tips output is presented within the page flow (no navigation to another page).

requirements.summary: Create and apply a cohesive visual theme (non blue/purple-dominant) with responsive layout and consistent component styling.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a consistent design system (buttons, inputs, cards, headings) aligned to one chosen theme.
The primary palette is not blue/purple-dominant.
The layout is responsive and remains usable on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Add global theme tokens (CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn styling) and base typography/spacing defaults using a distinctive non-blue/purple-dominant palette (e.g., warm neutrals + green/amber accents), ensuring consistent styling across hero, sections, form, and output.
Apply the chosen theme consistently using Tailwind utility classes and shadcn-ui composition for headings, sections, cards, and CTAs; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align the Daily Check-in form controls and results (score/tips) to the shared design system (consistent spacing, button styles, card layout) and ensure mobile-first responsiveness; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add required generated static images under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them on the one-page site.
acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images are present under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified.
The landing page renders the generated images (e.g., hero/brand mark) without fetching them from the backend.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static hero illustration asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/physiotrack-hero.dim_1600x900.png for direct static serving.
Add the generated static app mark/logo asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/physiotrack-mark.dim_512x512.png for direct static serving.

Render the generated images from frontend/public/assets/generated/physiotrack-hero.dim_1600x900.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/physiotrack-mark.dim_512x512.png within the hero/branding area using standard static asset referencing (no backend fetch).
